name: places/ChIJ4ZeYPgL2wokRzml6NN7DKx4

displayName.text: East Harlem Scholars Elementary Academy I

adrFormatAddress: 2050 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10029-4705, USA

originalText.text: Hmmm.... I find some of these reviews really odd, I think this school is overly communicative, to the point of being annoying.  I am always getting calls or texts, from the teachers and staff reporting on my son's behavior or work. I think overall it is a good school. The schoolwork is challenging, lots of afterschool choices, they even have Saturday school for kids who are struggling.The new building has air conditioning and an elevator. Its super clean. I didnt like the founding principal (Ms. Batista Sao- Roque) but as the school expanded she has delegated her responsibilities to other principals. The only con about this school for me is the fact that the gym and auditorium are all one space so its really uncomfortable for performances.

originalText.text: I Like my School I was in this school for 5 years.i hope i can stay in this school. the teachers are great at their job. great learning place. So Clean Never A Mess. Oh the food is so good there Pizza, Buggers with Veggies Milk Not juice. Over All its a GREAT School i'm so lucky to be in this school. Btw there's no bullying in East Harlem Scholars Academy. And the High School is the same like East Harlem Scholars Academy But its in a Old building. They Are still working on the high school so it can look not that old! And they help scholars for tests and state test they even have satruday school for scholars that need help. they also have Art, Music and etc to show your feelings for those things. and also they have after school for activates to show how much you love art and music and etc. they also have A WInter and Spring spectacular to show how much you like singing! Over All i recommend you to go to this school.

originalText.text: This has got to be the most uncommunicative school ever. the Staff are horrible. The school is so unorganized and they honestly don't have the school and kids under control. Office staff are rude and unprofessional.  and teachers would rather tell students to move schools and not deal with them. Get better stuff and Directors

text.text: This has got to be the most uncommunicative school ever. the Staff are horrible. The school is so unorganized and they honestly don't have the school and kids under control. Office staff are rude and unprofessional.  and teachers would rather tell students to move schools and not deal with them. Get better stuff and Directors

originalText.text:
Negligence has been a serious issue at this school. My kindergarten sons' property has been damaged (numerous times) in a way fingers can not possibly damage property such as book bags, uniform shirts and sneakers. My son was forced to walk home from this building with a gash in his right sneaker, keep in mind this was only his 3rd day wearing his new sneakers. No one is able to tell us how his property is being destroyed despite the fact that there is always more than one adult present. Dean of students Mauricio Rojas has been very unprofessional as well as dishonest. He has called my personal phone at inappropriate hours. He also contacted me during work hours to tell me that my son stabbed a classmate with a pencil which we later found to be false. I don't appreciate anyway making false accusations such as this one about my 6 year old, black in America son.
Rojas is now being promoted to Director of School Culture and Family Engagement despite what has transpired. I've met with multiple staff members and filed a formal complaint; the help has been inadequate! So much so that I recently sent a service request to the Mayors Office and plan to reach out to City Council shortly. My family are not victims,  we are soldiers. We stand up and fight for our children as well as what's right! ..... ðŸ’“
